User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Lightning/1.0b2 Thunderbird/3.1.9

When you edit a pre-existing mailing list in the address book, i.e add a new user or remove a user, upon returning to the address book there is now two copies of the mailing list. 

Closing and opening the mailing list fixes the issue and resorts to one mailing list. 

Whilst this isn't a problem after closing the issue, its a very confusing UI issue which can cause users to delete mailing lists (like I did!) which means you loose everything. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open Address Book
2.Click new contact 
3.Add Example Contact A, Click ok
4.Click new contact
5.Add Example Contact B, Click ok
6.Click new list
7.Add Example Contact A, and example contact B
8.Click ok
9.Open the list you just created and remove a user, click ok

Actual Results:  
You see two mailing lists listed in the address book both with the same name

Expected Results:  
You should only see one mailing list in the address book.
